content:
• Wednesday, June 6, 2018
  • ETR

    Entergy plans $1B share offering

    • Entergy (NYSE:ETR) -0.8% after-hours on news it has commenced a public offering of $1B worth of common shares with a forward component.
    • ETR says it expects to enter into forward sale agreements with Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs and J.P. Morgan Securities in which the company will issue and sell to the forward counterparties $1B worth of common shares.
    • ETR expects to grant the underwriters an option to purchase up to an additional $150M of shares to cover any over-allotments.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM | 14 Comments
  • REVG

    REV Group names Walsh new chief operating officer

    • REV Group (NYSE:REVG) has announced it's named Ian Walsh as its chief operating officer.
    • The move is effective as of last Friday. He replaces Thomas Phillips, who will stay on as an adviser through the end of the fiscal year.
    • Walsh previously worked at Textron, where he's been CEO/President of TRU Simulation and Training.
    • Shares of REV Group are down 14.3% after hours following a miss on earnings; they had risen 5.4% during the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • BA

    Boeing's stock strength a sign that China fears are overblown, Cramer says

    • Boeing (NYSE:BA) jumped another 3.2% to within $0.04 of a 52-week high, and CNBC's Jim Cramer thinks the stock's recent rally is a "terrific sign" that trade tension over China is overblown.
    • Shares of Boeing, which had planned to sell $1T worth of aircraft to China over the next two decades, were hurt initially by China's April tariffs on U.S. products but the stock's recent rally served to improve the outlook for the company, indicating to investors that its strength was not tied solely to its business in China, according to Cramer.
    • "There are literally a dozen airline purchasers who would love to get in the queue if China drops out, and that's despite the recent declines in the airline stocks because of [a] 50% increase in the price of fuel," Cramer says.
    • Separately, Raymond James analyst Harry Breach says the joint venture in auxiliary power units announced by Boeing and Safran earlier this week is a "significant move," although it could take decades to have its full impact.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM | 15 Comments
  • ESND

    Essendant -10.6% as FTC issues second request on GPC deal

    • Essendant (NASDAQ:ESND) is off 10.6% after hours after it notes it's gotten a second request for information from the FTC on its proposed merger with Genuine Parts' (NYSE:GPC) S.P. Richards business.
    • That move (which Essendant anticipated) extends the waiting period for the merger until 30 days after the companies substantially comply with the request.
    • In the update, Essendant notes its board evaluated a GPC proposal for Essendant shareholders to get a right to a contingent cash payment of up to $4/share. But Essendant's board determined the CVR wasn't in its interests, and the two companies determined that the merger agreement wouldn't be amended to include the CVR.
    • Regarding an unsolicited proposal from Staples, Essendant says Staples hasn't entered into a revised confidentiality agreement and otherwise hasn't engaged in discussions.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM
  • THO

    Thor Industries -7% after disappointing quarter, warning on tariffs

    • Thor Industries (NYSE:THO) -7% after-hours as it reports weaker than expected FQ3 earnings and in-line revenues while citing "headwinds" from U.S. tariffs on imported steel.
    • THO says it is seeing "inflationary price increases in certain raw material and commodity-based components due in large part to the headwinds created by the announcement and implementation of the steel and aluminum tariffs and other regulatory actions, as well as higher warranty costs," although the company says it should offset the cost increases over time.
    • THO expects "another record year" as FY 2018 winds down, but warns of tough Y/Y comparatives for Q4 earnings and sales which will be compared to record sales in the prior-year Q4.
    • During Q3, THO says overall gross profit margins fell to 14.1% from 14.6% in the prior-year period, reflecting increased costs primarily associated with an extended warranty program on certain products, as well as slightly higher labor and material costs.
    • Other RV names are lower, including REV Group (NYSE:REVG) -14.2% after also reporting disappointing earnings; also, WGO -7.7%, LCII -4.1%, CWH -1.4%, PII -0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM | 42 Comments
  • ZS

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/06/2018)

    • Gainers: ZS +15.1%. FIVE +14.5%. AXON +7.9%. CMTL +3.9%. OKTA +3.1%.
    • Losers: PTI -35.5%. REVG -14.3%. AMSC -7.9%. THO -5.7%. MDB -5.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • BHLB

    Berkshire Hills Bancorp +4.8% on move to SmallCap 600

    • Berkshire Hills Bancorp (NASDAQ:BHLB) is 4.8% higher after hours on news that it's moving into the S&P SmallCap 600 in latest index changes.
    • It's replacing Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings (NASDAQ:OLLI), which is heading into the MidCap 400. OLLI is up 0.7% after hours.
    • And Ollie's replaces Orbital ATK (NYSE:OA), whose acquisition by Northrop Grumman is closing today.
    • The moves are effective prior to the open on Monday.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • HEAR

    Turtle Beach +1.7% on new esports partnership

    • Turtle Beach (NASDAQ:HEAR) announces a new partnership with esports franchise Team Allegiance.
    • Turtle Beach will equip the Rocket League team with audio equipment in the Rocket League Championship Series and players in Super Smash Bros., Melee, and mobile esports titles Arena of Valor and Clash Royale.   
    • Financial terms of the partnership not disclosed.
    • Turtle Beach shares are up 1.7% aftermarket to $18.10 after closing today up 6.3%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • AGN

    Allergan up 3% after hours on reports of Icahn stake

    • Allergan (NYSE:AGN) is up 3% after hours on light volume in apparent response to chatter that activist investor Carl Icahn is accumulating shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 23 Comments
  • PTI

    Proteostasis announces positive early-stage data on PTI-801; investors unimpressed; shares down 36% after hours

    • MIcro cap Proteostasis Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTI) is down 36% after hours on robust volume in apparent response to the release of Phase 1 data on CFTR corrector PTI-801.
    • The trial was designed to assess the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of PTI-801 in cystic fibrosis (CF) patients on background Orkambi (lumacaftor/ivacaftor) therapy.
    • 48 CF patients completed the 14-day treatment period with three escalating doses of PTI-801 or placebo. Safety and pharmacokinetic results were as expected. At the higher doses, PTI-801 demonstrated statistically significant improvements in sweat chloride (SC) and body mass index (BMI) compared to placebo. The improvement in SC was comparable to the effect for Kalydeco (ivacaftor).
    • Improvements in lung function, determined by a measure called ppFEV1, was observed across all three doses but the changes were not statistically significant.
    • By the end of month, the company expects to initiate a Phase 2 study of the once-daily triplet regimen of PTI-428, PTI-808 and PTI-801.
    • Results from the ongoing study of doublet therapy PTI-801 and PTI-808 and triplet therapy data will be reported later this year.
    • Management will host a conference call today at 5:00 pm ET to discuss the results.
    • Related ticker: (NASDAQ:VRTX)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 41 Comments
  • CMTL

    Comtech +4.2% on beat-and-raise in Q3 results

    • Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) is up 4.2% postmarket after its Q3 earnings beat expectations on top and bottom lines, and a boost to expected EBITDA.
    • Net sales rose to $147.85M, and bookings were $164.3M. Book-to-bill ratio was 1.11.
    • Backlog, meanwhile, is a near-record $583.7M -- a conservative number that doesn't include the parts of existing multi-year contracts that haven't been funded.
    • Operating income rose to $13.98M from $10.15M, and net income rose to $8.2M from $4.42M. EBITDA was $23.5M.
    • For the fiscal year, it's sticking with a revenue target of $570M-$585M, but raising its adjusted EBITDA target to $73.5M-$76.5M from a previous $72M-$76M, or growth of 6% at the midpoint.
    • Conference call to come tomorrow at 8:30 a.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • CLDR

    Cloudera -6.3% on Q1 beats with weak Q2 guidance

    • Cloudera (NYSE:CLDR) drops 6.3% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 29% Y/Y revenue growth.  In-line Q2 guidance has revenue of $107M to $108M (consensus: $107.16M) and EPS of -$0.13 to -$0.15 (consensus: -$0.15). 
    • FY19 guidance has revenue from $435M to $445M (consensus: $440.77M) and EPS of -$0.62 to -$0.59 (consensus: -$0.59).
    • Key metrics: Subscription revenue, $85.9M (+33% Y/Y); Subscription revenue as % of total, 84% (+3 percentage points); loss from operations, $24.4M; operating cash flow, $24.4M; total operating expenses, $119.7M; cash and equivalents, $82.4M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Cloudera beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 21 Comments
  • OKTA

    Okta +2.7% on Q1 beats, upside FY guidance

    • Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) gains 2.7% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat on EPS and revenue estimates with a 58% Y/Y revenue growth. Q2 guidance has upside revenue from $84M to $85M (consensus: $82.85M) and in-line EPS of -$0.21 to -$0.20 (consensus: -$0.21).  
    • Upside FY19 guidance has revenue from $353M to $357M (consensus: $347.1M) and EPS from -$0.58 to -$0.54 (consensus: -$0.64).
    • Key metrics: Net cash from operations, $4M; FCF, -$1.6M; cash and equivalents, $547M; total operating expenses, $84.5M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Okta beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 16 Comments
  • FIVE

    Five Below +6% on strong guidance

    • Shares of Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE) move higher after the retailer reports a 3.2% gain in comparable sales during FQ1.
    • "Continued outperformance from our new stores and healthy comparable sales were accompanied by strong gross margin performance, SG&A leverage and tax rate favorability, resulting in EPS that more than doubled versus last year," notes CEO Joel Anderson.
    • Looking ahead, Five Below expects Q2 sales of $332M to $335M vs. $327M consensus and EPS of $0.36 to $0.38 vs. $0.34 consensus Full-year guidance is for revenue of $1.502B to $1.517B vs. $1.51B consensus and EPS of $2.42 to $2.48 vs. $2.41 consensus.
    • FIVE +5.86% to $86.01.
    • Previously: Five Below beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • MDB

    MongoDB -2.5% on Q1 that met on EPS, in-line EPS guide

    • MongoDB (NASDAQ:MDB) drops 2.5% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat revenue estimates with a 49% Y/Y growth but met on EPS. Q2 guidance has upside revenue from $51M to $52M (consensus: $50.11M) and in-line EPS from -$0.46 to -$0.45 (consensus: -$0.46).
    • FY19 guidance has raised upside revenue from $217M to $220M (consensus: $214.44M; was: $211M to $215M) and in-line EPS from -$1.62 to -$1.66 (consensus: -$1.63).  
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM with a webcast available here.
    • Press release. 
    • Previously: MongoDB EPS in-line, beats on revenue (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • CMTL

    Comtech Telecommunications beats by $0.22, beats on revenue

    • Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL): Q3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.22.
    • Revenue of $147.85M (+15.7% Y/Y) beats by $2.48M.
    • Shares +4.97%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • EFX

    Equifax +6% touches four-month high as execs meet with investors

    • Equifax (NYSE:EFX)  jumped 6% on heavy volume and earlier touched $125.63, a four-month high, as its CEO and CFO meet with some investors in Boston today. The last time it was higher was when it reached $125.69 on Jan. 31.
    • Some 2.4M shares changed hands, more than twice its three-month average of 931,219.
    • A press release on the Equifax website says CEO Mark Begor and CFO John Gamble were set to make a presentation at the Baird conference in New York yesterday and then meet with some investors in Boston today; the company did not post any presentation material on its website.
    • Last September, EFX lost 31% of its market value in the week after it disclosed a massive data breach in which hackers accessed information on more than 145M U.S. consumers. It still hasn't recovered to pre-data-breach levels.
    • Former GE exec Begor took over as CEO in April, replacing interim chief, Paulino do Rego Barros Jr., who took the post after the data breach.
    • Previously: Equifax gets a 'turnaround guy' as new CEO (March 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZYME

    Zymeworks readies stock offering

    • Zymeworks (NYSE:ZYME) has filed a preliminary prospectus for an $85M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be determined.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 10 Comments
  • PBR

    Brazil court blocks Petrobras' sale of TAG gas pipeline network

    • A Brazilian federal court judge issues an injunction temporarily blocking Petrobras' (PBR -2.1%) potential ~$7B sale of pipeline operator Transportadora Associada de Gas, siding with oil workers who want the company's assets and the high-paying jobs that go along with them in government-controlled hands.
    • Platts reports the injunction is a surprise after PBR retooled its $21B divestment program for 2017-18 under the auspices of Brazil's Federal Audit Court, which had ordered the company to implement greater transparency measures in the asset sales program.
    • PBR reportedly is in discussions with France’s Engie (OTCPK:ENGIY) over a sale contract for the TAG network, which accounts for 47% of Brazil's gas pipeline infrastructure and 26% of total gas transportation capacity.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 16 Comments
  • CWH

    Camping World leads RV names higher

    • Camping World (NYSE:CWH) made a late break higher after execs presented a rosy picture at the Baird 2018 Global Consumer, Technology & Services Conference.
    • The company says it saw brisk business levels in May and into June as the U.S. weather improved.
    • Camping World finished 7.61% higher, while Winnebago (NYSE:WGO) gained 7.17% and Thor Industries (NYSE:THO) rose 2.62%. LIC Industries (NYSE:LCII) also joined the EV party, rising 5.42% off the positive Camping World talk.
    • Baird conference webcast
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 13 Comments
  • ZS

    Zscaler beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • Zscaler (NASDAQ:ZS): Q3 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $49.16M (+49.2% Y/Y) beats by $3.19M.
    • Shares +3.1%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • VKTX

    Viking Therapeutics readies stock offering; shares slip 2% after hours

    • Viking Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VKTX) is down 2% after hours on light volume on the heels of its announced public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 10 Comments
  • MRTX

    Mirati Therapeutics readies stock offering

    • Mirati Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MRTX) launches a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • NKTR

    Nektar outlines key objectives at investor conference; shares up 7%

    • Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +7.1%) is up on more than a 4x surge in volume on the heels of its corporate presentation at Jefferies Healthcare Conference. Key objectives:
    • NKTR-181: NDA filed in late May. Actively pursuing commercial partners or "other strategic alternatives" for the program.
    • NKTR-214: Advancing into Phase 3 in kidney and bladder cancer [in combination with Bristol-Myers Squibb's Opdivo (nivolumab)].
    • Phase 1/2 study with Takeda's TAK-659 in a range of cancers to launch in H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 17 Comments
  • CLF

    Cleveland-Cliffs +4% as Citi starts with Buy recommendation

    • Cleveland-Cliffs (CLF +4%) enjoys strong gains after Citigroup initiates coverage with a Buy rating and $11 price target, citing the company's "significant logistical, quality and cost advantages" in providing high quality iron units to steel mills in an improved domestic market.
    • Citi analyst Daniel Knauff also notes CLF is the only major independent supplier of iron ore pellets to the domestic market and has secured its revenue stream with sales under longer-term, partially fixed pricing contracts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 52 Comments
  • FIT

    Roth says Fitbit still on track after CFO exit; FIT +2.9%

    • Roth Capital says Fitbit (NYSE:FIT) is still on track despite the CFO departure.
    • Analyst Scott Searle says incoming CFO Ron Kisling, former CFO of Nanometrics, has worked in multiple senior roles at software companies, which could come in handy as Fitbit develops its digital therapeutic model.
    • Searle: “We believe that as new products and details related to the digital therapeutics model emerge in 2H that FIT can continue to trade higher.”
    • Roth maintains a Buy rating and $8 price target.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word. 
    • Fitbit shares are up 2.9% to $6.42. 
    • Previously: Fitbit CFO will leave company (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • DCP

    DCP Midstream -2.5% after Stifel downgrades to Hold

    • DCP Midstream (DCP -2.5%) is lower after Stifel downgrades shares to Hold from Buy with a $42 price target, seeing a balanced risk/reward ratio in the short term while it continues to favor DCP for the long term given its focus on downstream investment, cash flow growth accelerating into 2019 and an improving financial profile.
    • Stifel resumes coverage of Enable Midstream Partners (ENBL +1.2%) with a Hold rating and sets an $18 target price, touting ENBL's stable asset base with modest growth while also noting an overhang caused by a sponsor's plans to divest its holdings over the coming years.
    • The firm also resumes coverage of EnLink Midstream Partners with a Hold rating and $18 price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • SYNT

    Wellington Shields steps to sidelines on Syntel

    • Wellington Shields downgrades Syntel (NASDAQ:SYNT) from Gradually Accumulate to Hold.
    • Syntel shares are up 0.6% to $32.58. Shares are up 3.6% in the past week, 10% on the month, and 40.8% YTD.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • PVTL

    Pivotal Software +11.2% ahead of earnings report

    • Pivotal Software (NYSE:PVTL) shares gain with no current catalyst but ahead of next Tuesday’s earnings report, the first since the IPO.
    • Analyst consensus expects EPS of -$0.13 and revenue at $140.44M.   
    • Pivotal shares are up 11.2% to $20.50. Shares are up 17.2% YTD since going public.    
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • D

    Cove Point LNG facility set for planned outage, CEO says

    • Dominion Energy's (D -1.8%) Cove Point liquefied natural gas production facility in Maryland will undergo a maintenance shutdown this fall, CEO Thomas Farrell tells Reuters.
    • Asked about any potential interruption in LNG exports from the site, the CEO says it would depend on whether gas storage tanks with capacity to hold nearly 15B cf were exhausted.
    • Cove Point, with a nameplate capacity of 5.25M metric tons/year of LNG, has been at full production of LNG from natural gas since April, Farrell says.
    • “You’ll see a very significant increase in U.S. natural gas coming to Asia and in particular Japan," says Farrell, who was in Yokohama at a ceremony to celebrate last month’s start of Japanese imports of Cove Point LNG and the arrival of a second Cove Point vessel at a Tokyo Gas terminal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 12 Comments
  • AYX

    Alteryx +6.2% on insider selling

    • Alteryx (NYSE:AYX) CRO Robert Scott Jones discloses selling 6,076 shares at an average price of $33.82 for a total value of about $205.5K.
    • Alteryx shares are up 6.2% to $38.48. Shares have gained 10.9% in the past month and 43.5% YTD.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 8 Comments
  • IDT

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/06/2018)

    • Gainers: IDT +21%. NCTY +12%. PS +8%. IFON +8%. PVTL +8%.
    • Losers: AMBA -13%. YY -12%. LTRX -11%. AMRH -11%. BVSN -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 7 Comments
  • PS

    Pluralsight +6.7% with no clear catalyst

    • Pluralsight (NASDAQ:PS) shares are up 6.7% to $24.67 with no clear catalyst.
    • Pluralsight shares are up 7.2% on the week and 15.7% YTD since the IPO about three weeks ago.       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • PAH-OLD

    WSJ: Platform Specialty Products near sale of ag chemicals unit for ~$3B

    • Platform Specialty Products (PAH-OLD +3.2%) pushes higher after a WSJ report says it is in advanced talks to sell its agricultural chemicals business to Wilmcote Holdings for ~$3B, with a deal possibly to be announced this month.
    • A sale would offer PAH a path to completing its plan of splitting its two divisions into distinct companies, each with a more focused strategy and improved balance sheet, WSJ explains.
    • PAH shares have lost more than half their value in recent years, hurt by weakness in the agricultural segment and by concerns over the company’s ability to manage a heavy debt load.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 8 Comments
  • KMX

    Gabelli sees CarMax breaking to new highs

    • CarMax Group (NYSE:KMX) moves up 1.52% after the analyst team at Gabelli initiates coverage on the auto retailer with a Buy rating. CarMax is seen benefiting from the surge in off-lease returns and trade-ins in the U.S.
    • Gabelli assigns a price target of $95 to CarMax to rep +30% upside potential for shares.
    • The 52-week high on CarMax is $77.64.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • FSLR

    Buy the dip in First Solar as China changes a 'red herring,' analyst says

    • This week's plunge in First Solar (FSLR -5.7%) hits 18% following Monday's news that China's government would cut subsidies and curb construction on new solar projects; BofA Merrill Lynch downgraded the stock yesterday and JMP Securities issued a double downgrade today.
    • Roth Capital analyst Philip Shen believes FSLR's selloff presents an attractive buying opportunity, saying the Chinese policy changes are a "red herring" which does not materially change 2018, 2019 and even 2020 economics for the company.
    • Shen thinks China's policy changes potentially give fuel for the U.S. International Trade Commission to maintain Section 201 tariffs beyond two years on the aggressive module ASP collapse that is expected ahead; he reiterates a Buy rating and $90 price target on the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 35 Comments
  • BVSN

    BroadVision attempt at breaking downtrend not quite there, shares down 11%

    • Thinly traded nano cap BroadVision's (BVSN -10.6%) try at breaking free of its long-term downtrend is sputtering. Shares had rallied almost 70% since Monday before retracing. Shares are currently down 31% from the intraday high of $3.10.
    • At the end of March, it had ~$7.9M in quick assets while operations consumed ~$1.5M in Q1. In 2017, operations consumed $9.6M so the company may need to raise capital at some point this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • TMQ

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/06/2018)

    • Gainers: TMQ +7%. DVN +6%. LGCYP +6%.
    • Losers: GEVO -13%. GNE -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • IMTE

    IMTE spikes 23%, to three-week high

    • Integrated Media Technology (NASDAQ:IMTE) has made another sharp move up with no apparent reason.
    • Shares are up 23% today to their highest point in three weeks.
    • The only news out of the company is a 6-K filing this morning noting that its subsidiary, Marvel Digital Limited, got recognized by Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam for an award it won in Geneva for its glasses-free 3D technology.
    • MDL had won two awards at the inventions conference in Geneva for its Advanced Image Rendering Algorithms for Autostereoscopic 3D Displays.
    • The stock inexplicably jumped nearly 2,000% intraday on May 2, closing at $21.95 after closing at $2 the day before; shares are at $17.95 currently.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • LW

    Lamb Wesson lower after french fry tariff

    • Lamb Wesson (LW -2.3%) trades lower in what could be a reaction by investors to the imposition of a tariff by Mexico on U.S. french fry products.
    • Company execs told Vertical Group that Lamb Wesson has already been winding down its business in Mexico.
    • Vertical Group launched coverage on Lamb Wesson with a Sell rating a few weeks ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • PRPH

    ProPhase Labs up 12%

    • Thinly traded nano cap ProPhase Labs (NASDAQ:PRPH) is trying to claw back from the recent bout of profit-taking after doubling when it announced a $1 special dividend in a month ago. Shares are up 12% on more than triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 150K shares.
    • At the end of March, the company had $21.7M in quick assets while operations consumed only $167K in Q1 so it has sufficient capital for the time being.
    • Previously: ProPhase up 40% on $1 dividend (May 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • AIHS

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/06/2018)

    • Gainers: AIHS +14%. AMRB +10%. GNW +8%. YRIV +7%. AFH +7%.
    • Losers: XRF -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • NOC

    Northrop Grumman lifts guidance after FTC clearance to close Orbital ATK

    • Northrop Grumman (NOC +2%) moves higher after raising 2018 guidance to reflect the Federal Trade Commission's clearance of its proposed $7.8B acquisition of Orbital ATK.
    • For FY 2018, NOC now sees EPS of $16.20-$16.45 vs. $15.46 analyst consensus estimate on revenues of ~$30B vs. $27.1B consensus, ahead of prior guidance of EPS of $15.40-$15.65 and revenues of ~$27B, as well as free cash flow of $2.3B-$2.6B.
    • NOC expects to complete the OA takeover tomorrow after the market closes.
    • Also: Defense sector watch amid $716B Senate bill (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • AXON

  • Ten-year yield pushes back toward 3%

    • The 10-year Treasury yield tumbled from above 3% to nearly 2.75% last week amid the panicky action in Italian government paper.
    • Though Italy's 10-year yield is up 16 basis points today to 2.92%, its (and the EU's) existential crisis has passed for the moment.
    • That's hitting U.S. government bond prices, with the 10-year Treasury up another 4.5 basis points today to 2.97%. TLT -0.9%, TBT +1.8%
    • That, in turn, is hitting income favorites like REITs, with IYR -0.55% and VNQ -0.4% vs. the S&P 500, Dow, and Nasdaq all in the green.
    • See Seeking Alpha's coverage of Nareit's REITWeek
    • #REITWeek
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 5 Comments

  • AMZN

    Home insurance stocks move on potential Amazon disruption

    • The Information reports that Amazon (AMZN +0.5%) is considering offering home insurance on the idea that robots and smart devices can monitor homes for threats, which can lower premiums.
    • Amazon is developing robots for the home it hopes to have tested in employee homes by year’s end. The robots have cameras and sensors that can detect smoke, carbon monoxide, excess heat, and loud noises. But it could be years before the robots hit the consumer market. 
    • The company doesn’t have concrete plans for a product and has yet to launch any insurance products despite a partnership with JP Morgan and Berkshire Hathaway to overhaul health insurance. 
    • Home insurance companies have partnered with smart home companies in the past such as Liberty Mutual Insurance offering $100 off of August Home’s smart locks and 5% off home insurance. 
    • Home insurance stocks that could move on the news: Allstate (ALL -0.8%), Chubb (CB), Travelers (TRV -0.6%), AIG (AIG +0.1%).  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 64 Comments

  • NCS

    NCI Building System up 7% Q2 beat

    • NCI Building Systems (NCS +7.7%) reported Q2 sales growth of 8.7% Y/Y to $457.1M, reflecting continued commercial discipline in rising cost environment, along with volume growth in metal components and insulated metals segments and growth in package volumes in metal coil segment.
    • Q2 Overall margins: Gross declined by 121 bps to 22.8%, operating declined by 358 bps to 4.15% and Adj. EBITDA was flat at 9%.
    • Engineered building systems sales were $167.24M (+2.8% Y/Y), operating margin improved by 130 bps to 5.54% and Adj. EBITDA margin improved by 128 bps to 7%.
    • Metal components sales were $168.45M (+8.8% Y/Y), operating margin improved by 20 bps to 13.1% and Adj. EBITDA margin improved by 48 bps to 14.1%.
    • Insulated metal panels sales were $113.41M (+10.2% Y/Y), operating margin fell by 1,747 bps to 1.36% and Adj. EBITDA fell by 315 bps to 11.4%.
    • Metal coil coatings sales were $95.19M (+7.3% Y/Y), operating margin improved by 50 bps to 7.5% and Adj. EBITDA improved by 18 bps to 9.7%.
    • Backlog was $631.6M up 10.8% Y/Y, as of April 29, 2018.
    • The Company improved and replaced its debt structure, reducing current effective cash interest rate from ~7.0% to 3.6% and extending the term to 2025.
    • 3Q18 Guidance: Revenue $525-545M and Adj. EBITDA $56-66M.
    • Previously: NCI Building Systems beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (June 5)

  • SCYX

    SCYNEXIS announces publication of early-stage SCY-078 data; shares up 2% premarket

    • SCYNEXIS (NASDAQ:SCYX) announces the publication of results from a Phase 1 study of SCY-078, assessing the risk for drug-drug interactions when administered with drugs metabolized by the CYP family of enzymes, in The Journal of Clinical Pharmacology.
    • SCY-078, the first representative of a novel oral and intravenous triterpenoid antifungal family, is in clinical development for the treatment of multiple serious fungal infections.
    • The open-label, crossover study showed that co-administration of rosiglitazone with SCY-078 after repeat dosing had no clinically meaningful effect on rosiglitazone exposure compared with administration of rosiglitazone alone. SCY-078 was well absorbed and tolerated following the loading dose, and repeated daily doses of rosiglitazone.
    • Shares are up 2% premarket.
